title: How do bicarbonate ions form in seawater? - Quora

response.answer_text: By reaction of carbon dioxide with water. Since seawater is slightly alkaline, the most accurate way to represent it would be CO + OH → HCO After thinking about Marian Doscillo’s comment, I realized that a better answer would be it comes from the reaction of carbon dioxide with carbonate ions, which are present due to the dissolution of carbonate minerals like limestone. CO + CO→ 2 HCO
